title: The Comment Policy Is “Victorian Sufi Buddha Lite”
summary:
Key ideas:
- The Sufi saying of passing words through three gates before speaking
- Commenters on Slate Star Codex must pass at least two of the three gates before commenting: true and necessary, true and kind, or kind and necessary
- Spam is not permitted
- There is a REPORT button for comments that violate the policy
- The author reviews reported comments and will delete or ban commenters for violating the policy
- The author is trying to reduce low-quality comments, especially from Reactionaries

Key learnings:
- The importance of being mindful of what we say and how we say it
- The impact of comments on online communities
- The value of having clear guidelines and policies for comments

Key questions:
- Is it possible to have a completely civil and respectful online discussion?
- How can moderators effectively balance free speech with maintaining a safe and positive environment for everyone in the community?
- What other strategies can be used to improve the quality of online discussions and reduce toxic behavior?
